name: KNIGHTS
description: KNIGHTS is a minimalist puzzle game based on a single chess piece, the titular knight. A simple enough to pick up and relaxing experience.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista/7/8/10 Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Graphics Card Supporting DirectX 9.0c DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 70 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: First impression: quiet puzzle game  After 20 of almost 100 levels, this game feels a lot like  LYNE : not only is the design similar, it is a good game to break out when you have a little time. Like LYNE, it also features new bonus levels daily. The levels work a little like a labyrinth: you won't need a moment of inspiration, but it is very easy to work yourself into a dead end if you're not careful. A mobile release is planned, but so far, this game is Steam only.  Recommended.   This game runs well on my old Windows XP machine.

Knights is a simple game revolving around the Knight piece in chess. You must move the colored pieces into the corresponding squares. The game starts off easy, but gradually makes it more difficult, often requiring thinking and or trial and error. For $0.99, this game is a steal!!!  Final Rating: 8/10

This appears to be a puzzle game with a chess theme.  You're basically moving your Knight around the board trying to get it onto a particular square in order to solve the puzzle .  You start of easy with one blue knight and after solving a few puzzles the difficulty is ramped up and a red knight appears along with the blue knight.  You then have to try and move the red knight and blue knights into the correct position.  Probably gets more difficult as the game goes on ,i haven't played long enough just yet to see how.    Nice relaxing puzzle game with easy on the eye graphics style.

As a long time chess player, I figured I would give this game a try. I was not disappointed. The puzzles are challenging and enjoyable. They get a little boring over time so I would recommend breaks while playing. If you like a good mental workout, try this game!  I'd rate it 7.5/10

this a very sweet game.   Usually, I'm not into puzzle game but this one is very relaxing and interesting.  You can setup control, resolution, etc.. (its based on unity engine) ~  I think this game have cards and achievement too.

Decent puzzle game with simple but good enough presentation. The idea is an old one (basing puzzles around the way knights move around a chessboard), but some of the individual puzzles play with it in interesting ways and are pretty clever.
Nice puzzle game! Easy to learn how to play and very fun, cheap and recommended :)
A challenging and intriguing game, definitely worth 8 HKD -- 10/10.
I liked this one. The rules are extremely simple and levels are short. The feeling is very zen. Decent complexity progression. Finally, the price is right.  10/10 will kill time again.

Not a bad time sink for a little bit, but the later levels really become tight and oppressive. There later levels feel less like a chess puzzle and more like a one-by-one slide puzzle, which drains you fast. I'd recommend Lyne over this game, if you had the option. But, if this is on sale and you're looking to kill an hour or two, it's hard to argue with the price, just don't expect an enjoyable late game.
Needed a simple game to play while listening to music. This is perfect.

There's a reason this game has zero negative reviews: it is pleasing to the eye, ear (super pretty ambient music track), and mind. Just a lovely, chill, relaxing, rewarding game. The puzzles are challenging, but not annoying or insanely difficult, and all totally logic based. No knowledge of chess required (but the checkboard pattern plays an important part in helping you figure out where to move / store pieces). I'm over halfway through after several days of off and on play, and haven't had to skip any boards yet. If you get stuck, just reset the board and start over, and you'll likely figure out the solution quickly. You can take as many turns as you want, there's no time penalty or move limit / counter. Ridiculously cheap. Bug free, and fully functional. Probably the best value on Steam that I've come across yet. I play this to mellow out after other games or situations leave me stressed and annoyed. If logic puzzles appeal to you in the slightest, buy this game, you won't regret it, I guarantee. 11 out of 10. Simple perfection.
It's super fun and super cheap. 8/10

While the game may not have technical flaws that I know of, the gameplay itself is kind of underwhelming.  The game itself is very simple: you have red and blue knights and you have to get all the pieces into similarly colored squares. The easy levels do a fair job at teaching the main mechanics, but then the difficulty level starts swaying all over the place. While there is some strategy to the harder levels, there's not very much in the way of set patterns or rules of thumb etc.   I also didn't like the 45 degree tilt to the game board. It's very hard for myself to visualize the movements in the default orientation.
